name: Quidditch
description: A magical sport played on flying broomsticks with seven players per team, involving scoring goals with the Quaffle and catching the Golden Snitch.

name: Chaser
description: A player who scores goals by throwing the Quaffle through the opposing team's hoops (10 points per goal).

name: Keeper
description: A player who guards the goalposts to prevent the opposing team from scoring.

name: Beater
description: A player who uses a bat to hit Bludgers away from teammates and toward opponents.

name: Seeker
description: A player who tries to catch the Golden Snitch, earning 150 points and ending the match.

name: Blagging
description: Foul: Seizing an opponent’s broom tail to slow them down.

name: Blatching
description: Foul: Flying with the intent to collide with an opponent.

name: Blurting
description: Foul: Locking broom handles with another player to steer them off course.

name: Bumphing
description: Foul: Beaters hitting Bludgers toward spectators, endangering them.

name: Cobbing
description: Foul: Using elbows excessively during play.

name: Flacking
description: Foul: Keeper defending the goal from behind the hoop.

name: Haversacking
description: Foul: Hand still on Quaffle as it passes through the hoop.

name: Quaffle-pocking
description: Foul: Tampering with the Quaffle to give advantage.

name: Snitchnip
description: Foul: Any player other than the Seeker touching or catching the Snitch.

name: Stooging
description: Foul: More than one Chaser entering the scoring area at once.

name: Oakshaft 79
description: A sturdy broom with excellent stability, designed for endurance flying.

name: Moontrimmer
description: An early racing broom known for altitude and speed, created in 1901.

name: Silver Arrow
description: A fast broom model that followed the Moontrimmer, used in early competitions.

name: Cleansweep Series
description: A popular racing broom series including Cleansweep 1 through 11.

name: Comet Series
description: A family of racing brooms like the Comet 140, 180, and 260.

name: Tinderblast
description: A dependable broomstick produced in the 1940s by Ellerby & Spudmore.

name: Swiftstick
description: Faster than the Tinderblast but has poor turning control and ascent.

name: Shooting Star
description: An affordable broom known to lose speed and control with age.

name: Nimbus Series
description: High-performance broomsticks including the Nimbus 1000 through 2001.

name: Twigger 90
description: A flashy broom from Flyte and Barker that proved unreliable in competition.

name: Firebolt
description: An elite racing broom known for speed, precision, and magical features.

name: Bluebottle
description: A lesser-known broom model listed among wizarding families' possessions.

name: Firebolt Supreme
description: A World Cup-level broom used by the Bulgarian team in 2014.

name: Starsweeper XXI
description: An American-made broom used during the 2014 Quidditch World Cup.

name: Thunderbolt VII
description: A fast broom used by the Nigerian national team in 2014.

name: Varåpidos
description: A high-end broomstick used by the Brazilian team in 2014.

name: Yajirushi
description: A Japanese broom model featured in the 2014 World Cup.

name: Quaffle
description: A red leather ball used by Chasers to score goals (10 points each).

name: Bludger
description: A black iron ball that flies around trying to knock players off their brooms.

name: Golden Snitch
description: A tiny, winged golden ball that ends the game and awards 150 points to the team whose Seeker catches it.
